definition[0]: to receive money, land, or property from someone after they have died
example[0]: She’ll come into quite a lot of money when her father dies.
example[1]: Josie doesn’t come into the movie until quite near the end.
example[2]: Where do I come into all this?
definition[2]: if something comes into view, you begin to see it
example[3]: The mountains were just coming into view.
definition[3]: to start to produce leaves or flowers
example[4]: The roses are just coming into flower.
definition[4]: used to say that something is not important
example[5]: Money doesn’t really come into it.
definition[5]: to become very good, useful, or important in a particular situation
example[6]: On icy roads, a four-wheel drive vehicle really comes into its own.
